title: Official US Trailer for Czech Film 'Her Body' Starring Natalia Germani
description: "I'm an actress." Film Movement has unveiled an official trailer for a Czech film called Her Body, a raw & intimate feminist drama from filmmaker Natálie Císarovská making her feature directorial debut. This first premiered last year at the 2023 Karlovy Vary Film Festival and already opened in theaters in Czechia last year. It's now set for a December 2024 release soon in the US in very limited theaters. When a spinal injury shatters Andrea's dream of success as an Olympic diving champion, she goes on to make a name for herself as an adult film star. Based on a true story. A successful athlete, and member of the Olympic team, Andrea Absolonová's life changes after a vertebra injury forces her to end of her sports career. Instead she moves on into nude modeling and eventually becomes a successful and well-known porn actress in Czechia. Starring Natalia Germani as Andrea, with Cyril Dobrý, Denisa Baresová, Zuzana Mauréry, Martin Finger, Zuzana Stivínová, and Tereza Svejdová. Looks like a provocative true story – if you're curious, dive in. excerpt: "I'm an actress." Film Movement has unveiled an official trailer for a Czech film called Her Body, a raw & intimate feminist drama from filmmaker Natálie Císarovská making her feature directorial debut. text: TRAILERS by December 1, 2024Source: YouTube "I'm an actress." Film Movement has unveiled an official trailer for a Czech film called Her Body, a raw & intimate feminist drama from filmmaker Natálie Císarovská making her feature directorial debut. This first premiered last year at the 2023 Karlovy Vary Film Festival and already opened in theaters in Czechia last year. It's now set for a December 2024 release soon in the US in very limited theaters. When a spinal injury shatters Andrea's dream of success as an Olympic diving champion, she goes on to make a name for herself as an adult film star. Based on a true story. A successful athlete, and member of the Olympic team, Andrea Absolonová's life changes after a vertebra injury forces her to end of her sports career. Instead she moves on into nude modeling and eventually becomes a successful and well-known porn actress in Czechia. Starring Natalia Germani as Andrea, with Cyril Dobrý, Denisa Baresová, Zuzana Mauréry, Martin Finger, Zuzana Stivínová, and Tereza Svejdová. Looks like a provocative true story – if you're curious, dive in. Here's the official US trailer (+ poster) for Natálie Císarovská's film Her Body, direct from YouTube: Professional Czech high diver Andrea Absolonová’s (starring Slovakian actress Natalia Germani) Olympic dreams are shattered when she suffers a devastating injury while training. Forced to leave the sport she loves, Andrea follows a photographer friend of hers into the world of nude modeling & adult photography, ultimately reinventing herself as adult actress Lea De Mae and performing in over 80 porn films. Based on the tragic true story, Her Body chronicles Andrea Absolonová’s journey as she navigates the seductive undercurrents of fame and desire, and her quest for self-liberation in this powerful portrait of resilience. Her Body, originally known as Její telo in Czech, is directed by up-and-coming Czech filmmaker Natálie Císarovská, making her feature directorial debut after a few other short films previously. The screenplay is written by Natálie Císarovská and Aneta Honzkova. Produced by Katarina Krnacova and Viktor Schwarcz. This initially premiered at the 2023 Karlovy Vary Film Festival last year & opened in Czechia last fall. Film Movement will open Císarovská's Her Body film in select US theaters starting on December 20th, 2024. Find more posts: Indies, To Watch, Trailer prev next
html:
TRAILERS

by
December 1, 2024
Source: YouTube

"I'm an actress." Film Movement has unveiled an official trailer for a Czech film called Her Body, a raw & intimate feminist drama from filmmaker Natálie Císarovská making her feature directorial debut. This first premiered last year at the 2023 Karlovy Vary Film Festival and already opened in theaters in Czechia last year. It's now set for a December 2024 release soon in the US in very limited theaters. When a spinal injury shatters Andrea's dream of success as an Olympic diving champion, she goes on to make a name for herself as an adult film star. Based on a true story. A successful athlete, and member of the Olympic team, Andrea Absolonová's life changes after a vertebra injury forces her to end of her sports career. Instead she moves on into nude modeling and eventually becomes a successful and well-known porn actress in Czechia. Starring Natalia Germani as Andrea, with Cyril Dobrý, Denisa Baresová, Zuzana Mauréry, Martin Finger, Zuzana Stivínová, and Tereza Svejdová. Looks like a provocative true story – if you're curious, dive in.

Here's the official US trailer (+ poster) for Natálie Císarovská's film Her Body, direct from YouTube:

Professional Czech high diver Andrea Absolonová’s (starring Slovakian actress Natalia Germani) Olympic dreams are shattered when she suffers a devastating injury while training. Forced to leave the sport she loves, Andrea follows a photographer friend of hers into the world of nude modeling & adult photography, ultimately reinventing herself as adult actress Lea De Mae and performing in over 80 porn films. Based on the tragic true story, Her Body chronicles Andrea Absolonová’s journey as she navigates the seductive undercurrents of fame and desire, and her quest for self-liberation in this powerful portrait of resilience. Her Body, originally known as Její telo in Czech, is directed by up-and-coming Czech filmmaker Natálie Císarovská, making her feature directorial debut after a few other short films previously. The screenplay is written by Natálie Císarovská and Aneta Honzkova. Produced by Katarina Krnacova and Viktor Schwarcz. This initially premiered at the 2023 Karlovy Vary Film Festival last year & opened in Czechia last fall. Film Movement will open Císarovská's Her Body film in select US theaters starting on December 20th, 2024.

Find more posts: Indies, To Watch, Trailer
